item.title: 瑞银报告称，美国去年每天新增 1000 多位百万富翁
item.description: 周三公布的一份报告显示，去年美国财富增长过快，超过 37.9 万人成为新的美元百万富翁，每天超过 1000 人。【原文：Wealth grew disproportionately quickly last year in the United States, where over 379,000 people became new U.S. dollar millionaires, more than a 1,000 a day, a report published on Wednesday showed.】

item.title: 独家报道蒂森克虏伯副董事长因 "根本不信任 "将投票反对新首席执行官合同
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯副董事长将在周五的董事会上投票反对首席执行官米格尔-洛佩斯的续约，称他在将股份出售给亿万富翁丹尼尔-克雷廷斯基后，没有兑现钢铁部门扭亏为盈的承诺。【原文：Thyssenkrupp's deputy chairman will vote against the contract extension of CEO Miguel Lopez at a board meeting on Friday, saying he had not delivered a promised turnaround of the steel unit after selling a stake to billionaire Daniel Kretinsky.】

item.title: 欧盟接受阿里巴巴抓取非法网络产品的承诺
item.description: 欧盟委员会周三表示，已接受阿里巴巴旗下阿里速卖通（AliExpress）做出的承诺，以解决通过其平台传播潜在非法和淫秽材料的问题。【原文：The European Commission on Wednesday said it had accepted commitments made by Alibaba's AliExpress to address concerns over the dissemination of potentially illegal and pronographic materials through its platform.】

item.title: 俄罗斯储蓄银行计划推出具有推理能力的 LLM
item.description: 俄罗斯最大的银行 Sberbank 第一副首席执行官 Alexander Vedyakhin 在接受路透社采访时表示，该公司计划推出具有推理能力的 Gigachat 大型语言模型 (LLM) 版本。【原文：Russia's largest lender, Sberbank, plans to unveil a version of its Gigachat large language model (LLM) with reasoning capabilities, First Deputy CEO Alexander Vedyakhin told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 独家报道俄罗斯储蓄银行警告经济过热，称关键利率低于 15%将刺激经济增长
item.description: 俄罗斯最大的银行 Sberbank 第一副首席执行官 Alexander Vedyakhin 在接受路透社采访时表示，由于利率过高，俄罗斯经济可能会过度降温，并可能难以回到增长轨道。【原文：The Russian economy could cool down excessively due to high interest rates and may face difficulties returning to a growth path, Alexander Vedyakhin, First Deputy CEO of Russia's largest lender, Sberbank, said in an interview with Reuters.】

item.title: 中国将在 STAR Market 上设立板块，接纳盈利前成长型企业
item.description: 中国证券监管机构周三宣布，计划在上海科技股市场（STAR）设立一个新的板块，以接纳盈利前的成长型公司。【原文：China's securities regulator announced plans on Wednesday to set up a new segment on Shanghai's tech-heavy STAR market to host pre-profit growth companies.】

item.title: 希腊零售商敦促欧盟提前征收低价值包裹费
item.description: 路透社看到的一封信显示，希腊零售商希望欧盟提前对进入欧盟的低价值电子商务包裹征收 2 欧元（2.30 美元）的手续费。【原文：Greek retailers want the European Union to bring forward the introduction of a two euro ($2.30) handling fee for low-value e-commerce packages coming into the bloc, a letter, seen by Reuters, showed.】

item.title: 法国工会与雇主将于下周举行最后一次养老金谈判
item.description: 法国工会和雇主将于下周举行最后一次谈判，商讨 2023 年养老金改革方案，但至少有一个主要参与方不确定是否会加入谈判。【原文：French unions and employers negotiating changes to a 2023 pension reform are set to hold last-ditch talks next week, even as at least one major participant was not sure if it would join.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，本田公司将因制动踏板问题召回超过25.9万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，本田汽车公司（Honda Motor）将在美国召回259,033辆汽车，原因是这些汽车的制动踏板存在故障，可能会偏离位置并妨碍制动，从而增加撞车或受伤的风险。【原文：Honda Motor is recalling 259,033 vehicles in the U.S. due to a faulty brake pedal that can shift out of position and hinder braking, raising the risk of crashes or injury, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 能源巨头锁定东南亚，争夺更多天然气以满足人工智能电力需求
item.description: 能源巨头正在马来西亚和印度尼西亚投入天然气勘探和生产，以满足该地区人口增长和数据中心激增带来的电力需求。【原文：Energy majors are pouring money into gas exploration and production in Malaysia and Indonesia to meet rising power demand from growing populations and a proliferation of data centres in the region.】

item.title: 韩国央行行长称不反对基于韩元的稳定币，但有外汇方面的担忧
item.description: 韩国央行行长周三表示，他不反对发行韩元计价的稳定币，但对管理资本流动感到担忧。【原文：South Korea's central bank governor said on Wednesday he was not against issuing won-denominated stablecoins but had concerns about managing capital flows.】

item.title: 德国 PBB 公司在结束美国业务时撤回指导意见
item.description: 德国最大的房地产金融机构之一--德国储蓄银行（Deutsche Pfandbriefbank）周三表示，由于终止在美国的业务产生了特殊支出，该行将撤回全年业绩指引。【原文：Deutsche Pfandbriefbank , one of Germany's top property financiers, said on Wednesday that it was withdrawing its full year guidance amid extraordinary expenses from discontinuing its business in the United States.】

item.title: 国媒称中国将稳定发放剩余消费品补贴
item.description: 据国营媒体《证券时报》周三报道，中国将有序发放剩余的消费品以旧换新资金，目前中央政府正在指导地方政府稳妥使用这笔资金。【原文：China will issue the rest of its consumer goods trade-in funds in an orderly manner and the central government is now guiding local governments to use the funds at a stable pace, state media Securities Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: Blackstone 旗下博彩公司 Cirsa 计划在西班牙上市
item.description: 黑石集团（Blackstone）旗下的游戏公司 Cirsa 周三表示，计划今年在马德里证券交易所首次公开发行股票，筹集多达 4.6 亿欧元（5.2946 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Blackstone's gaming company Cirsa said on Wednesday it planned to raise as much as 460 million euros ($529.46 million) in an initial public offering of shares on the Madrid stock exchange this year.】

item.title: 资金耗尽，中国部分城市暂停购车补贴
item.description: 根据路透社对政府公告的审查，6 月份中国至少有六个城市和直辖市暂停了对购车者的以旧换新补贴，这可能会减缓世界第二大经济体的新车销售。【原文：At least six cities and municipalities across China have suspended trade-in subsidies for car buyers in June, according to Reuters’ review of government announcements, which could slow new car sales in the world's second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 债券投资者青睐亚洲，马来西亚创下资金流动纪录
item.description: 逃离美国的债券投资者正在稳定且利润丰厚的亚洲债务市场上寻找避风港，其中马来西亚是外国资金的首选目的地。【原文：Bond investors fleeing the United States are finding a haven in stable and lucrative Asian debt markets, with Malaysia leading the pack as the destination for foreign money.】

item.title: 日本央行的通胀警告为今年再次加息留有余地
item.description: 日本央行在再次加息之前可能会停顿很长时间，但今年仍有采取行动的余地，因为它对可能播下过高通胀种子的不断扩大的价格压力持谨慎态度。【原文：The Bank of Japan may take a long pause before raising interest rates again, but it has still left scope for action this year by signaling caution over broadening price pressures that could sow the seeds of too-high inflation.】

item.title: 石破茂离开 G7，美国贸易协议和政治前途成疑
item.description: 本周，日本首相石破茂希望美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）放宽危及其国家经济和政治前途的关税的努力落空，这凸显了盟国之间的鸿沟，因为更多的关税即将开始征收。【原文：Japanese premier Shigeru Ishiba's bid to get U.S. President Donald Trump to relax tariffs imperiling his country's economy and his political future fell flat this week, underlining the gulf between the allies as more levies are set to kick in.】

item.title: 西欧人不去美国旅行，跨大西洋机票价格下滑
item.description: 从欧洲到美国的机票价格已降至自大流行病发生前从未有过的水平，因为西欧游客引领了赴美旅游的回潮，预计这种情况至少会持续到 7 月份。【原文：Airfares from Europe to the United States have dropped to rates not seen since before the pandemic, as travelers from Western Europe lead a pullback in travel to the U.S. that is expected to continue through at least July.】

item.title: 韩国央行称美国关税可能带来价格下行压力
item.description: 韩国央行周三表示，美国加征关税可能会对国内价格造成下行压力，因为由于华盛顿的征税，更多的中国商品可能会被运往邻国而不是美国。【原文：South Korea's central bank said on Wednesday that U.S. tariffs were likely to exert downward price pressure domestically as more Chinese goods might be sent to neighbouring countries rather than the U.S. because of Washington's levies.】

item.title: 中国比特币挖矿机主导制造商在美国建立生产基地以抵御关税
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税战重塑了加密货币供应链，全球最畅销的三家比特币挖矿机制造商--全部来自中国--正在美国建立生产基地。【原文：The world's three best-selling makers of bitcoin mining machines - all of Chinese origin - are setting up manufacturing footholds in the United States as President Donald Trump's tariff war reshapes the cryptocurrency supply chain.】

item.title: 早间竞价美联储会议结果出炉前阴霾弥漫
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 空中客车公司将提高派息范围，并确认指导原则
item.description: 空中客车公司（Airbus）周三表示，将把股息支付率上限从目前的 30%-40% 扩大到 30%-50%。【原文：Airbus said on Wednesday that it will extend its upper range of its dividend payout to 30%-50% from the current payout ratio of 30%-40%.】

item.title: 新加坡金管局调查显示经济学家下调国内生产总值和通胀预期，并认为将进一步放宽政策
item.description: 新加坡金融管理局（Monetary Authority of Singapore）周三对预测者进行的一项调查显示，经济学家下调了对新加坡今年经济增长和通货膨胀的预测，并预计下个月将进一步放宽货币政策。【原文：Economists have lowered their forecasts for Singapore's growth and inflation this year and are expecting a further easing of monetary policy next month, a survey of forecasters by the Monetary Authority of Singapore showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国在推动多极货币体系建设中谈论数字人民币
item.description: 中国央行行长承诺扩大数字人民币在国际上的使用，并呼吁发展多极化全球货币体系，让几种货币主导世界经济。【原文：The head of China's central bank pledged to expand the international use of the digital yuan and called for the development of a multi-polar global currency system, where several currencies dominate the world economy.】

item.title: 地区顶级银行家称，高盛利用改革提升亚洲投资银行份额
item.description: 华尔街高盛新任命的地区投资银行主管告诉路透社，高盛将在亚洲进行重大改革，以占据更大的投资银行市场份额，并抓住 "强劲的发展机遇"。【原文：Goldman Sachs will leverage a major revamp in Asia to capture a larger share of the investment banking market and capitalize on "strong tailwinds", the Wall Street bank's newly appointed regional investment banking chief told Reuters.】

item.title: 投资者在美联储会议前关注以色列与伊朗冲突，美元持稳
item.description: 周三早些时候，美元兑主要货币保持涨势，受安全需求提振，因为在美联储当天晚些时候做出利率决定之前，以色列和伊朗之间的冲突令投资者惶惶不安。【原文：The U.S. dollar held on to gains against major currencies early on Wednesday, buoyed by demand for safety as conflict between Israel and Iran kept investors on edge ahead of a Federal Reserve decision on interest rates later in the day.】

item.title: 中东冲突愈演愈烈，市场翘首以待美联储
item.description: 周三，对中东敌对行动升级的担忧仍是市场关注的焦点，导致油价上涨，投资者急于购买安全的美国国债和美元，同时抛售股票。【原文：Concerns over escalating hostilities in the Middle East stayed front and centre in markets on Wednesday, sending oil prices higher and investors rushing for the safety of U.S. Treasuries and the dollar while dumping stocks.】

item.title: 山姆-奥特曼称 Meta 为 OpenAI 员工提供了 1 亿美元奖金
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-阿尔特曼（Sam Altman）说，Meta 为其员工提供了 1 亿美元的奖金来招募他们，因为这家科技巨头正努力加强其人工智能战略。【原文：OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said that Meta has offered his employees bonuses of $100 million to recruit them, as the tech giant seeks to ramp up its artificial intelligence strategy.】

item.title: 伊朗-以色列冲突进入第六天，油价继续上涨
item.description: 周三早盘，由于担心伊朗和以色列的冲突可能会扰乱石油供应，油价在上一交易日结束时上涨了4%以上。【原文：Oil prices ticked up in early trading on Wednesday after ending the previous session up more than 4% on worries that the Iran-Israel conflict could disrupt supplies.】
